title: Short Framerate Spikes/Hiccups when wards are being placed and other random hiccups
body:
Hey guys - I'm having an odd problem and i haven't been able to locate any information on it - was hoping if anyone could help me out! 

When playing the game, It generally runs very smoothly, i can run it on max settings, lowest settings, and I generally have no issues with one glaring exception. 

It seems like when **large teamfights break out / new abilities being used/ wards are being placed for the first time**, I incur an odd stutter that causes my client to freeze up for about a quarter of a second? like a short little delay. It can royally mess me up sometimes. 

Anyone experience anything like this? It's pretty frustrating when it happens. Any ideas on what I can try? i've tried every setting i can think of, updating drivers, ect ect.

replies.body:
Based off your description, you may be experiencing these issues because of odd local settings or corrupt game files. When you're in a game and a file that the game needs to access is corrupt or missing, it will have to download and patch the file in the moment the client requests it. This will often create a stutter or skip, as it's trying to catch up while you play the game. Trying the solutions in our [FPS troubleshooting guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) should address the most common fixes for these issues.

Let me know if this helped.

No, this happens even with a fresh install, and has been happening ever since the new summoner's rift map. It has nothing to do with corrupt game files or odd local settings. The more likely scenario is that ever since the new map, you guys have had to re-code how the "loading screen" works, and the game is not properly loading all the required assets in the loading screen anymore, which results in the need to pull them from the hard drive (instead of the RAM) when certain new assets (skills, wards, etc) are used in game, which results in slowdowns because HD access is slower than RAM access.

Also: I believe you are wrong about the game patching "the moment the client requests it." I have extensively looked into how the game handles corrupt/missing files, and it seems to work like this:

1) Game detects a missing or corrupt file. If the game doesn't crash it ignores it, and pretends it doesn't exist.

2) Game puts a blank file called "SOFT_REPAIR" into "C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_game_client\releases\<current patch folder>"

3) The next time the patcher loads, it will check for "SOFT_REPAIR" and if it exists it will say your game files are corrupted, and ask you to repair. It will then scan ALL your files, repair corrupt/missing ones, and delete "SOFT_REPAIR"

tl;dr whoever coded how the "loading screen" works before a match did it wrong when they updated it for the new map. Which was a REALLY long time ago at this point.

PS: I just tried running League from a ram-drive, and so far I have had almost zero slowdowns. Which just further proves my point (your spaghetti code is trying to read the HD during the game instead of during the load screen like it's supposed to - causing slowdowns). The RARE slowdowns I have had were reduced to a 0.05 second stutter using the RAM-Drive, and happen maybe once every 2 or 3 games. Compare that to the 0.25 second stutters I get when running from a normal HD, which happen 5-10+ times per game.

If you have enough RAM you can try running League on a 6 GB ramdrive (if your folder is too big for that you may need to do a fresh install to delete some of the garbage). You'll need at least 12 GB of RAM for it to run properly. If you have more than 12 GB of RAM you can make your ramdrive a bit bigger if necessary.

Let me know if it works.
